sub_fields.title: Who you’re targeting, how you’ll reach them, and why this matters for Cardano?
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
We’re focusing on 5,000 high school students in underserved rural communities who currently lack access to quality tech education.



How we’ll reach them:

We’ll collaborate with local schools, education authorities, and community leaders to implement the curriculum directly in classrooms, ensuring hands-on learning and active engagement.



Why this matters for Cardano:

By integrating Cardano blockchain education, we’re not only empowering students with future-ready skills but also fostering real-world blockchain adoption and innovation in these communities, aligning with Cardano’s mission of driving positive social impact.

sub_fields.title: Provide a list of key activities of your project:
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Curriculum Development Workshops: Collaborate with educators and blockchain experts to design and refine the curriculum, ensuring it’s relevant and engaging.



Hands-On Blockchain Projects: Facilitate student-led projects that apply Cardano blockchain concepts to real-world problems, fostering innovation and creativity.



Community Engagement Events: Organize events that bring students, parents, and local leaders together to showcase student achievements and promote blockchain literacy in the community.



Blockchain Awareness Campaigns: Launch outreach initiatives to raise awareness about blockchain technology and Cardano’s role, targeting both students and their families.



Continuous Feedback Loops: Implement ongoing assessments and feedback sessions to refine and improve the program, ensuring it remains effective and impactful.

sub_fields.title: What are your success metrics?
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Student Participation Rate: Percentage of targeted students who actively engage in the program.



Curriculum Completion Rate: The proportion of students who successfully complete the entire blockchain curriculum.



Knowledge Assessment Scores: Improvement in student knowledge and skills as measured by pre- and post-program assessments.



Community Feedback: Positive feedback from students, parents, and educators about the program’s impact and effectiveness.



Long-Term Adoption: The extent to which students continue to explore and apply blockchain technology beyond the program.



Program Scalability: Successful replication of the program in additional schools and communities, indicating a sustainable model.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
We aim to implement a comprehensive blockchain education program centered on the Cardano ecosystem for 5,000 high school students in underserved rural communities. This program will combine theoretical knowledge with hands-on projects, enabling students to grasp foundational blockchain concepts and practical applications.



How It Addresses the Problem:

This solution directly tackles the lack of access to quality tech education by providing a tailored curriculum that’s both engaging and relevant. It empowers students with the skills needed for the digital economy, opening up new opportunities for further education and employment. Additionally, by focusing on Cardano, we’re promoting sustainable, real-world blockchain adoption, which aligns with the broader mission of technological empowerment in underserved areas.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
ncreased Blockchain Literacy: By educating 5,000 students, we’re cultivating a new generation of blockchain-savvy individuals who can contribute to the Cardano ecosystem, bringing fresh perspectives and innovative ideas.



Talent Pipeline: The program helps create a pipeline of young talent with blockchain expertise, potentially leading to more developers, entrepreneurs, and advocates within the Cardano community.



Community Engagement: As students and their communities become more familiar with Cardano, it fosters broader adoption and positive sentiment towards the Cardano blockchain, strengthening the overall ecosystem.



Local Economic Growth: Empowering underserved communities with tech skills can lead to increased local opportunities, entrepreneurship, and economic development, benefiting the wider Cardano network.



Innovation and Use Cases: By introducing blockchain to young minds, we’re encouraging innovative thinking that could lead to new Cardano-based applications, projects, and solutions, enriching the ecosystem’s diversity and resilience.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
12 Miles is a formally incorporated organization with a proven track record of delivering impactful technology education to underserved communities since 2020. Over the past three years, we have trained more than 11,000 students in STEM and digital skills. In 2025 alone, thanks to the support of Cardano Project 1300167, we trained over 5,000 students, directly reaching rural high schools. Our work has been recognized by local education authorities and even covered on TVC News [https://www\.youtube\.com/watch?v=v444Y5JKwTg](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v444Y5JKwTg) , highlighting our credibility and the tangible impact of our programs.

We operate with transparency, accountability, and a structured approach. All our programs are carefully documented, with attendance sheets, student assessments, and facilitator reports ensuring clear records of participation and learning outcomes.

We validate the feasibility of our programs through:Pilot Testing: Running small-scale programs in select schools to test curriculum, logistics, and student engagement.

Continuous Assessment: Using pre- and post-program evaluations to measure learning outcomes.

Stakeholder Feedback: Gathering input from students, teachers, and school administrators to refine delivery.

Public Recognition: Media coverage and endorsements from educational authorities further validate the effectiveness and credibility of our programs.

This combination of demonstrated experience, documented outcomes, and continuous feedback ensures that 12 Miles can deliver the proposed project with a high level of trust and accountability.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
The cost distribution reflects the value in several ways. First, by investing in curriculum development and translation, we ensure that high-quality, localized educational content is accessible, which adds real value to the Cardano ecosystem by promoting blockchain literacy.



Second, the pilot implementation and partnerships with schools help build a network of young learners and educators who are well-versed in Cardano’s technology. This not only expands the ecosystem’s reach but also cultivates a future generation of developers and enthusiasts.



Third, the conference and Quizathon create community engagement and visibility, showcasing the practical applications of Cardano and reinforcing its relevance in real-world scenarios.



Overall, the investment directly supports ecosystem growth by fostering education, community, and adoption of Cardano technology.
